concept.title: Device Driver Quick Start
concept.shortdesc: A quick introduction to the device driver documentation.

conbody.p: Device drivers provide a mechanism for applications and other operating system functions to access hardware devices without needing to know how each specific piece of hardware works. In addition device drivers may be written so that part of the device driver is user-side space and the rest is kernel-side so that the device driver can access shared memory and resources that belong to the Kernel.

section.title: Who this documentation is for
section.p:
There are two main sets of users for device drivers:
Application developers that want to use device drivers
Developers that need to create or amend device drivers.

This documentation set is aimed at the second category of users. If you are an application developer and want to use a particular device driver, then you should search for, and read the documentation for that specific device driver.

section.title: Device driver framework
section.p: The device driver guide explains the concepts of device driver framework and how to implement a device driver.

li.p: For the basic concepts of device driver, see Device Driver Concepts
To write a device driver, see Device Driver Writing Guide
To use the kernel services in a device driver, see Kernel-Side Services
To debug your device driver implementation, see Debug Monitor Tool
It is important to understand how memory is paged in the system, so you should also read Demand Paging.
